title: Ring of wealth

properties.value: The ring of wealth is an enchanted ring made by casting the spell Lvl-5 Enchant on a Dragonstone ring, requiring level 68 Magic and granting 78 experience. Like other dragonstone jewellery, it can be charged to provide teleports, albeit only at the Fountain of Rune. Wearing this ring (whether charged or not) while killing monsters will automatically pick up coins, tokkul, or numulites dropped by monsters. When worn it also removes the chance to receive a "nothing" drop when accessing the Rare drop table and Gem drop table. See below for more information about this feature.

content:
This article is about regular enchanted dragonstone ring. For for the imbued version, see ring of wealth (i).
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Ring of wealth
 This article has a money making guide: Recharging rings of wealth.
Please add tips to the subpage, rather than the article below.

SMW Subobject for UnchargedHigh Alchemy value: 10575Buy limit: 10000Examine: It can be charged at the Fountain of Rune.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Ring of wealthImage: File:Ring of wealth (uncharged).pngUses infobox: ItemWeight: 0.006Value: 17625Version anchor: UnchargedRelease date: 20 April 2004Item ID: 2572

The ring of wealth is an enchanted ring made by casting the spell Lvl-5 Enchant on a Dragonstone ring, requiring level 68 Magic and granting 78 experience. Like other dragonstone jewellery, it can be charged to provide teleports, albeit only at the Fountain of Rune. Wearing this ring (whether charged or not) while killing monsters will automatically pick up coins, tokkul, or numulites dropped by monsters. When worn it also removes the chance to receive a "nothing" drop when accessing the Rare drop table and Gem drop table. See below for more information about this feature.

The price difference between a fully charged ring and an uncharged one is 2,159, so each charge costs about 432.

Players can imbue the ring using a ring of wealth scroll, which can be purchased from Justine's stuff for the Last Shopper Standing for 5 Last Man Standing points. Wearing an imbued ring in the Wilderness doubles the chance of obtaining a clue scroll from monsters and from skilling.

Creation[edit | edit source]

Ring of wealth112,254
Profit6
  1. ^ Manual casting is 3 ticks, auto-casting is 7 ticks

Features[edit | edit source]

Rare drop enhancement[edit | edit source]

Wearing this ring completely removes the chance to receive "nothing" as a result of accessing the rare drop table and gem drop table. This also means the effective chance of receiving a gem or a mega-rare item from these tables is significantly increased, due to those two tables containing a "nothing" drop on them.

The ring of wealth approximately doubles the chance of receiving a regular item from the gem drop table by removing the 63 empty slots out of the 128 entries in the drop table. It also removes all 113 empty slots out of the 128 entries in the mega rare drop table, increasing the chance of obtaining a mega rare item by a factor of approximately 16.8 from the gem drop table, and by a factor of 8.5 from the rare drop table. The ring of wealth does not change the items dropped by any monster - it only increases the chance of getting an item from the rare drop table should the chance present itself.

It should be noted that the ring only needs to be worn by the player while dealing the killing blow before the loot appears. It does not have to be worn during the entire battle, so the player may wear a stat-boosting ring until the monster is at low health and then switch to the ring of wealth when the killing blow is about to be dealt.

It should be noted that the ring's rare drop enhancement only affects the specific drops that are accessed through the rare and gem drop tables. It does not boost the chances of receiving monster-specific unique drops, nor does it remove any "nothing" drops that are specific to a monster's own drop table. It also does not affect gem drops from monsters such as Ogress Warriors, considering their gem drops are not accessed through the gem drop table specifically.

Ironmen who desire a Dragon spear or Shield left half may opt to wear a ring of wealth when defeating monsters, especially if the monsters roll the rare drop table often, as they are significantly more likely to receive these items while the ring is worn. It is notable that the player doesn't have to start Legend's Quest to receive items from the mega-rare drop table if they are wearing the ring, although starting the quest does increase the likelihood of those drops.

Currency collection[edit | edit source]

With a ring of wealth equipped, any coins, tokkul, and numulites dropped by monsters that the player kills will automatically be added to the player's inventory instead of dropping on the ground. This can be toggled by right-clicking the ring.

The coin collection works as long as the player did the most damage to a monster. This means that if you leave before killing a monster and another player finishes it off for you, you will get the coin reward for it no matter how far away you may be.

Teleportation[edit | edit source]

The ring, like all other dragonstone jewellery, is useful when travelling in the Wilderness, as it will work up to level 30 Wilderness, while most other means of teleportation will not work above level 20 Wilderness. Players can access the teleports by either rubbing it in their inventory and selecting their destination from the option box which appears, or right-clicking it while equipped and selecting a destination. The ring of wealth may be preferable in the wilderness compared to an amulet of glory, as it can be worn and therefore the destination can be accessed directly from the right click menu, yet it is not visible on the character model, attracting less attention from player killers.

The ring has no charges when it is created, and can only be charged at the Fountain of Rune; not even a charge dragonstone jewellery scroll works on it. Charging it at the Fountain of Rune gives it five charges and enables it to be used to teleport to the following locations at a cost of one charge per teleport:

Destination Map
Miscellania[1]
Grand Exchange entrance
Falador Park
Dondakan, in the Keldagrim mine[2]
  1. ^ Requires completion of Throne of Miscellania
  2. ^ Requires completion of Between a Rock...

Price per teleport[edit | edit source]

The price per teleport of the ring changes depending on Grand Exchange prices. Below is a table that shows the current price, price per teleport, the money loss after selling the uncharged ring, and finally the cost per teleport after adjusting for selling the uncharged ring.

Item Ring Cost Total Loss Cost Per Teleport
Ring of wealth (5) 14,413 −2,159 −432

Boss log[edit | edit source]

The Boss Kill Log.

The ring of wealth has a right-click option to bring up a log recording various bosses the player has killed and the number of times the player has killed them.

Other features[edit | edit source]

Wearing a ring of wealth increases the number of feathers dropped by the evil chicken.

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

Master Flap North-east corner of the Death Altar 21,154

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
6 December 2018
(update)

The item's inventory sprite was adjusted slightly.

31 August 2017
(update)

Partially charged versions of the item could now be turned into bank placeholders.

22 June 2017
(update)

The "Dondaken" [sic] teleport option while equipped was renamed to "Dondakan"

9 February 2017
(update)

The uncharged version was made darker to distinguish it from charged versions.

17 January 2017
(update)

The boss and slayer kill logs have been restyled and can now track above 65,535 kills.

25 August 2016
(update)

The "Boss log" option was replaced with a "Features" option.

18 August 2016
(update)

The ring of wealth provides a higher likelihood of valuable drops within the rare drop table (by removing all empty drops) and it can now automatically collect coin drops into the inventory.

30 April 2015
(update | poll)

Demi-bosses now appear on the boss log.

26 February 2015
(update)

Partially charged versions of the item were made untradeable on the Trading Post/Grand Exchange.

11 September 2014
(update)

Typo within the boss log and kill counter have been corrected.

24 July 2014
(update | poll)
  • The Ring of wealth now tracks Boss kills and Barrows chests.
  • The "Boss log" option was added, allowing players to view boss kills.
27 March 2014
(update)
  • You can now charge the Ring of wealth at the Fountain of Rune for 5 teleports.
  • The "Rub" option was added, allowing for teleports.
30 April 2007
(update)

The item was graphically updated.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Initially, some players believed that wearing a ring of wealth would give a better chance of landing on a rare drop table when completing a clue scroll.[1] It has later been reconfirmed multiple times that this is not the case.[2][3][4]
  • The Ring of Wealth was added to the game before the Grand Exchange, which is reflected in its ability to teleport the player to Falador Park. Before the introduction of the Grand Exchange, the park served as a massive player-to-player trading hub in both members and free-to-play worlds.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Old School RuneScape. "Runescape Mythbusters Special." (18:17), YouTube video. 1 Dec 2014.
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 16 April 2015. (Archived from the original on 29 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Absolutely nothing."
  3. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 25 May 2015. (Archived from the original on 29 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Nothing. Not a darn thing."
  4. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 28 May 2015. (Archived from the original on 4 Sep 2020.) Mod Ash: "All rings of wealth *really* do nothing while you're solving the clue."

detail.png|left|140px]] }} The '''ring of wealth''' is an enchanted ring made by casting the spell [[Lvl-5 Enchant]] on a [[Dragonstone ring]], requiring level 68 [[Magic]] and granting 78 experience. Like other dragonstone jewellery, it can be charged to provide teleports, albeit only at the [[Fountain of Rune]]. Wearing this ring (whether charged or not) while killing monsters will automatically pick up [[coins]], [[tokkul]], or [[numulites]] dropped by monsters. When worn it also removes the chance to receive a "nothing" drop when accessing the [[Rare drop table]] and [[Gem drop table]]. See [[#Rare drop enhancement|below]] for more information about this feature. The price difference between a fully charged ring and an uncharged one is {{Coins|{{GEP|Ring of wealth (5)}}-{{GEP|Ring of wealth}}}}, so each charge costs about {{Coins|({{GEP|Ring of wealth (5)}}-{{GEP|Ring of wealth}})/5 round 0}}. Players can [[Ring of wealth (i)|imbue the ring]] using a [[ring of wealth scroll]], which can be purchased from [[Justine's stuff for the Last Shopper Standing]] for 5 [[Last Man Standing]] points. Wearing an imbued ring in the [[Wilderness]] doubles the chance of obtaining a [[clue scroll]] from monsters and from skilling. {{Infobox Bonuses |version1 = Uncharged |version2 = (1) |version3 = (2) |version4 = (3) |version5 = (4) |version6 = (5) |astab = 0 |aslash = 0 |acrush = 0 |amagic = 0 |arange = 0 |dstab = 0 |dslash = 0 |dcrush = 0 |dmagic = 0 |drange = 0 |str = 0 |rstr = 0 |mdmg = 0 |prayer = 0 |slot = ring }} ==Creation== {{Recipe |skill1 = Magic |skill1lvl = 68 |skill1boostable = Yes |skill1exp = 78 |members = Yes |ticks = 1 |ticksnote = Manual casting is 3 ticks, auto-casting is 7 ticks |mat1 = Dragonstone ring |mat2 = Cosmic rune |mat3 = Earth rune |mat3quantity = 15 |mat4 = Water rune |mat4quantity = 15 |output1 = Ring of wealth }} ==Features== ===Rare drop enhancement=== Wearing this ring completely removes the chance to receive "nothing" as a result of accessing the [[rare drop table]] and [[gem drop table]]. This also means the effective chance of receiving a gem or a [[mega-rare drop table|mega-rare]] item from these tables is significantly increased, due to those two tables containing a "nothing" drop on them. The ring of wealth approximately doubles the chance of receiving a regular item from the [[gem drop table]] by removing the 63 empty slots out of the 128 entries in the drop table. It also removes all 113 empty slots out of the 128 entries in the mega rare drop table, increasing the chance of obtaining a [[mega-rare drop table|mega rare]] item by a factor of approximately 16.8 from the [[gem drop table]], and by a factor of 8.5 from the [[rare drop table]]. The ring of wealth does not change the items dropped by any monster - it only increases the chance of getting an item from the rare drop table should the chance present itself. It should be noted that the ring only needs to be worn by the player while dealing the killing blow before the loot appears. It does not have to be worn during the entire battle, so the player may wear a stat-boosting ring until the monster is at low health and then switch to the ring of wealth when the killing blow is about to be dealt. It should be noted that the ring's rare drop enhancement only affects the specific drops that are accessed through the [[rare drop table|rare]] and [[gem drop table]]s. It does not boost the chances of receiving monster-specific unique drops, nor does it remove any "nothing" drops that are specific to a monster's own drop table. It also does not affect gem drops from monsters such as [[Ogress Warrior]]s, considering their gem drops are not accessed through the [[gem drop table]] specifically. [[Ironman Mode|Ironmen]] who desire a [[Dragon spear]] or [[Shield left half]] may opt to wear a ring of wealth when defeating monsters, especially if the monsters roll the rare drop table often, as they are significantly more likely to receive these items while the ring is worn. It is notable that the player doesn't have to start Legend's Quest to receive items from the mega-rare drop table if they are wearing the ring, although starting the quest does increase the likelihood of those drops. ===Currency collection=== With a ring of wealth equipped, any [[coins]], [[tokkul]], and [[numulite]]s dropped by monsters that the player kills will automatically be added to the player's inventory instead of dropping on the ground. This can be toggled by right-clicking the ring. The coin collection works as long as the player did the most damage to a monster. This means that if you leave before killing a monster and another player finishes it off for you, you will get the coin reward for it no matter how far away you may be. ===Teleportation=== The ring, like all other dragonstone jewellery, is useful when travelling in the [[Wilderness]], as it will work up to level 30 Wilderness, while most other means of teleportation will not work above level 20 Wilderness. Players can access the teleports by either rubbing it in their inventory and selecting their destination from the option box which appears, or right-clicking it while equipped and selecting a destination. The ring of wealth may be preferable in the wilderness compared to an amulet of glory, as it can be worn and therefore the destination can be accessed directly from the right click menu, yet it is not visible on the character model, attracting less attention from player killers. The ring has no charges when it is created, and can '''only be charged at the [[Fountain of Rune]]'''; not even a [[charge dragonstone jewellery scroll]] works on it. Charging it at the Fountain of Rune gives it five charges and enables it to be used to teleport to the following locations at a cost of one charge per teleport: {{TeleportLocationTableHead}} {{TeleportLocationLine|name=[[Miscellania]]|note=Requires completion of [[Throne of Miscellania]]|x=2534|y=3862}} {{TeleportLocationLine|name=[[Grand Exchange]] entrance|x=3163|y=3478|r=2}} {{TeleportLocationLine|name=[[Falador Park]]|x=2995|y=3375}} {{TeleportLocationLine|name=[[Dondakan]], in the [[Keldagrim mine]]|note=Requires completion of [[Between a Rock...]]|x=2824|y=10168|mapID=10}} {{TableBottom}} {{reflist}} ====Price per teleport==== The price per teleport of the ring changes depending on Grand Exchange prices. Below is a table that shows the current price, price per teleport, the money loss after selling the uncharged ring, and finally the cost per teleport after adjusting for selling the uncharged ring. {| class="wikitable align-center-1" ! colspan="2" |Item !Ring Cost !Total Loss !Cost Per Teleport |- |{{plinkp|Ring of wealth}}||Ring of wealth (5) |{{Coins|{{GEP|Ring of wealth (5)}}}} |{{Coins|{{GEP|Ring of wealth}} - {{GEP|Ring of wealth (5)}}}} |{{Coins|({{GEP|Ring of wealth}} - {{GEP|Ring of wealth (5)}}) / 5 round 0}} |} ===Boss log=== [[File:Boss Kill Log.png|thumb|300px|The Boss Kill Log.]]The ring of wealth has a right-click option to bring up a log recording various bosses the player has killed and the number of times the player has killed them. ===Other features=== Wearing a ring of wealth increases the number of feathers dropped by the [[evil chicken]]. ==Treasure Trails== {{EmoteClueHeader}} {{EmoteClue|tier=master|emote=Flap|location=North-east corner of the [[Death Altar]]|item1=Ring of wealth|item2=death tiara|item3=cape of legends|cost3=675}} {{EmoteClueBottom}} ==Products== {{Uses material list|Ring of wealth,Ring of wealth (5)}} ==Changes== {{Subject present |} ==Trivia== *Initially, some players believed that wearing a ring of wealth would give a better chance of landing on a rare drop table when completing a [[clue scroll]].{{CiteVideo|author=Old School RuneScape|title=Runescape Mythbusters Special|url=https://youtu.be/3YjtqnteX-A?t=18m17s|timestamp=18:17|site=YouTube|date=1 Dec 2014}} It has later been reconfirmed multiple times that this is not the case.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/588646928591749120|date=16 April 2015|archiveurl=https://archive.is/OOOLn|archivedate=29 May 2020|quote=Absolutely nothing.}}{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/602788990962372608|date=25 May 2015|archiveurl=https://archive.is/1DtX3|archivedate=29 May 2020|quote=Nothing. Not a darn thing.}}{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/603881764696805376|date=28 May 2015|archiveurl=https://archive.vn/oWN34|archivedate=4 Sep 2020|quote=All rings of wealth *really* do nothing while you're solving the clue.}} *The Ring of Wealth was added to the game before the [[Grand Exchange]], which is reflected in its ability to teleport the player to [[Falador Park]]. Before the introduction of the [[Grand Exchange]], the park served as a massive player-to-player trading hub in both members and free-to-play worlds. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Rings}} {{Dragonstone}} {{Teleportation items}}
